Singer-turned-actor Kim Hyun-joong is considering a return to the small screen, his agency said on Tuesday. According to KeyEast Entertainment, Kim recently received an offer to star in the upcoming 12-episode fantasy romance drama "When Time Stops," in which he would play a time traveler living a solitary life. KeyEast said Kim has not yet decided whether to accept the offer. His last screen appearance was in the 2014 drama "Inspiring Generation." As part of the LifeMedGreenRoof project, the Standardization Directorate within the Malta Competition and Consumer Affairs Authority (MCCAA) hosted the second workshop to launch a public consultation on the Draft National Green Roof Standard. As part of the EU 2020 Strategy, which aims to reduce energy demands by at least 20% by 2020, the European Commission's 2011 Energy Efficiency Plan identified buildings as having the greatest potential for energy savings. The plan focuses on mechanisms to reduce energy demands of existing buildings (especially public buildings) and the role of projects in promoting the introduction of energy efficiency measures. The European Commission's plan aims to achieve the 2020 Strategy's objectives of reducing energy consumption and promoting sustainable development. The workshop hosted by the MCCAA's Standardization Directorate is part of this goal, aiming to reduce energy demands of buildings and promote sustainable development in Malta through the promotion of green roof technologies.

Voter scams have been confirmed in multiple states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's top election official is warning residents about a potential scam aimed at getting sensitive information from potential voters, after similar concerns arose in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration assistance organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone and, in some cases, send absentee ballots to voters, Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin said. Under state law, residents cannot register to vote or request an absentee ballot over the phone.

For small businesses that operate on a credit basis, accounts receivable can make up a large portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, the auditor will verify that your claims about the accounts receivable balance can be substantiated. These claims are called assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, in which the auditor will ask your customers to confirm their account balances. Understanding which assertions can be substantiated through confirmation can help you understand why your auditor may require multiple audit procedures for the same account. Accounts receivable confirmation is primarily used to substantiate the existence assertion.

This kind of thing often happens: you press the snooze button on your alarm clock once, twice, or even three times, so when you finally finish washing up, get dressed, and are ready to face the new day, you're already lagging behind schedule. Usually, this results in you completely skipping breakfast. It turns out that your breakfast habits are a time-saving method that shouldn't be neglected. Firstly, eating a nutritious, high-protein, balanced breakfast every morning has been proven to be an effective way to activate your brain, improve focus, and performance. Additionally, eating breakfast is also associated with better weight control, as it provides energy for your body and may reduce hunger later in the day.

Dublin: Lawmakers voted overwhelmingly on Friday to support Ireland's first abortion bill, allowing terminations in exceptional circumstances where the woman's life is deemed to be at risk from pregnancy, marking a significant step for this predominantly Catholic country away from its total ban on abortion. Exhausted lawmakers applauded the 127-31 vote result on Friday, while outside the parliament gates, abortion rights activists cheered as they watched the result on their phones. The vote ended a grueling debate that began on Wednesday morning and ran until 5am on Thursday, resumed after a brief break, and continued until midnight on Friday. Lawmakers finally passed the bill, which will permit abortions in exceptional circumstances.

VOLGOGRAD, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to be undone by the sweltering heat of Volgograd on Friday when they face Nigeria in only their second World Cup match, after impressively holding two-time champions Argentina to a draw. Making their World Cup debut, Iceland are dreaming of advancing to the knockout stage and writing a new chapter in one of the greatest stories in international football in recent years. Standing in their way, however, is not only a Nigerian team desperate for a win after losing 0-2 to Croatia in their first match, but also the challenge of the southern Russian city's hot weather.

A pair of thieves in Greater Vancouver have been arrested and charged for allegedly engaging in long-term mail and identity theft. According to a press release issued by the Courtenay RCMP on November 11, the Courtenay RCMP and Canada Post investigators worked together to investigate the thefts, and identified and arrested the main suspects, obtaining a large amount of evidence through search warrants. Heine Hut, a 49-year-old Surrey man who is known to police, faces six charges, including mail theft, unauthorized use of a mail key, possession of stolen mail and stolen credit cards.

We first looked at which major brands had the most expensive maintenance costs over the first 10 years of a car's life. We grouped all models by brand and all years to calculate the average cost per brand. To estimate the annual maintenance cost, we found the cost of maintenance for every other oil change (because oil changes are typically done every six months). The German imports led the list by a fairly large margin, which isn't too surprising. Toyota and its two brands, Lexus and Scion, were one of the cheapest brands, saving owners at least $10,000 in maintenance costs over 10 years compared to BMW.

Aurora, Illinois - A suburban teenage boy has died after a tragic accident in a high school parking lot. Authorities said 17-year-old Stephen Woodcock of St. Charles died Monday morning, May 16, 2016, from a head injury he suffered Friday afternoon in the parking lot of Marmion Academy. According to police, the teen was riding on the passenger-side running board of an SUV when he lost his grip and fell backward, striking his head on the pavement, WGN reported. Police said Woodcock suffered head and other injuries. He was treated by paramedics at the scene and then airlifted to a hospital.

The Chief Executive Officer of FCOSS, Vani Catanasiga, said that almost 50 representatives from the District Council of Social Services (DCOSS) from Lami, Suva, Nadi, Nadroga, Lautoka, Savusavu, Labasa, and Rakiraki Social Service, passed the Accountability Framework after a two-day meeting in Lautoka.

Veteran Congressman Jim Leach (R-IA) lost his election in 2006. I'm not defending "moderate Republicans" per se, but it's worth mentioning! Leach, in my view, was absolutely the best Republican in the House. Nevertheless, one can only be glad about his defeat. The fact that it happened only shows how bad the situation in the entire Republican Party has become. Leach was a person with truly good instincts and some basically correct ideas about how America should conduct itself in the world, but he was useless in practice.

Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules against harassment on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet that threatened North Korea might "not be around much longer", Twitter was forced to explain why the president wasn't banned from the service. Twitter's public policy account posted a six-part tweet, in which the company said it considers "newsworthiness" and "public interest" when determining if a user has violated its rules. Twitter said these considerations have long been used internally to decide the fate of problematic users. Twitter said its rules are in place to ensure all users can use the service safely, but the company also considers whether certain tweets have news value or are in the public interest. In this case, Twitter determined Trump's tweet, though controversial, was newsworthy and of public interest, and took no action.

After keeping pace for the first two months of the year, real estate sales in Summit County took a dip in March, resulting in a noticeable decline in first-quarter numbers, according to a report by Slifer Smith & Frampton. The high-country real estate giant tracks various statistics for the local market, and according to the company's latest market report, Summit County saw its number of real estate transactions and total transaction volume decrease by about 12 percent in the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017.

Casey Brumbeloe, a senior at Stanhope Elmore High School, has been selected as a member of the Alabama State Department of Education's Student Advisory Council. Casey was one of 16 middle and high school students chosen from 80 applicants. The selection committee that reviewed student applications included representatives from the Alabama State Department of Education, CLAS, AASB, A+ Education Partnership, and the 2015-2016 Alabama Teacher of the Year. Students were chosen based on their leadership level in school and letters of recommendation. Council members will meet twice during the school year with State Superintendent of Education, Dr. Tommy Bice.

South Bend, Ind. -- The Irish took to the practice field for the final time on Thursday morning ahead of Saturday's Blue-Gold Game. One of the biggest questions the team faced at the start of spring practice remains unanswered: who will emerge at the linebacker position? Defensive coordinator Clark Lea said that fifth-year linebacker Asmar Bilal is the unit's closest thing to a "lock" at the moment, but he seems content with the uncertainty. He believes the position has made huge strides over the past month and a half, but with several months still to go before Week 1, he's in no hurry to have everything settled.

It's hard to understate the success and growing power of Amazon. Their market value is hovering around $1 trillion. Their growth rate is astonishing. By most estimates, Amazon now accounts for nearly 50% of the e-commerce sales in the US, about 5% of all retail sales, and is larger than their next 10 biggest competitors combined. One study found that about 55% of online product searches start on Amazon. This week, a report that Amazon is considering opening as many as 3,000 cashierless convenience stores, Amazon Go, by 2021, drew a lot of attention, even though they just opened their fourth location a few days ago.

New York — A lawyer who was caught on video berating workers at a New York City restaurant in Spanish issued an apology on Tuesday. "To the people I insulted, I apologize," he said. "Seeing myself in the video online was a wake-up call - the way I expressed myself was unacceptable and it's not the real me. I see that my words and actions hurt people and I'm truly sorry. While people should be able to express themselves freely, they should do so in a calm and respectful manner. The video doesn't show the real me. I am not a racist.

The town of South Upi is being haunted by a terrorizing incident involving residents of the island town of Patan in Sulu, and it is not coming from extremists, but from politicians. Residents are calling on the government for help to prevent another attack on their island community, which one resident claimed was due to their refusal to support the re-election bid of incumbent Mayor Anton Burahan. "We are helpless," said Bidding Jubair, a 60-year-old resident of Barangay Saidan village, recalling the January 2 attack on the island town allegedly by Burahan's followers, who used an M203 grenade launcher and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

German business confidence plummeted in October, falling to its lowest level in two and a half years, marking the sixth consecutive month of decline, dispelling any doubts that Europe's largest economy has been affected by the euro zone debt crisis. The Ifo Institute, a think tank based in Munich, said on Wednesday that its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of more than 7,000 companies, dropped to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The shadows over the German economy are growing darker," said Hans-Werner Sinn, president of the Ifo Institute. The euro fell to a one-week low against the dollar after the Ifo data was released, and European stocks turned negative.

The life of the mind has puzzled poets and neuroscientists, who attempt to map and label it, and in my case, to find it. In Irish tradition, thinking itself is a matter worthy of thought, and so there are many concepts in the Irish language that involve the mind, dreams, and imagination. As I am only a student, many of the nuances are still unclear to me, but language is about conversation. I would love to hear more mature insights from native speakers on Irish vocabulary related to thought.

New Delhi: A below-normal monsoon forecast by private weather agency Skymet had a significant impact on the stock benchmarks on Wednesday, causing them to give up their gains for the day after hitting a new record high. As per Skymet, the monsoon in 2019 is likely to be "below normal" at 93% of the long period average (LPA) of 887 mm for the four months of June to September. This led to a sharp correction in the bull run, wiping out the previous gains, with the market finally closing in the negative territory.

Los Angeles - A proposal to grant subpoena power to an oversight commission supervising the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department will go to voters in March 2020 after failing to win approval from the board of supervisors today. Proponents of the "Reform LA Jails" initiative collected nearly 250,000 signatures in support of the measure, which would also task a civilian oversight commission with studying ways to reduce the county's jail population and redirecting jail construction funds to alternatives to incarceration. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl said the issue should be put to a vote of the county's more than 10 million residents.

Hertfordshire Baseball Club received a £10,000 grant from Sport England to open a branch of the club in northwest London and provide the local community with the opportunity to play baseball. Hertfordshire Baseball Club has been based at Grovehill Ballpark in Hemel Hempstead since its formation in 1996. Over the years, the club has grown to become one of the largest baseball clubs in the UK, with eight teams competing in various adult and youth leagues run by the British Baseball Federation. In 2013, the club realized that in order to accommodate the increasing number of new players, it needed to expand.

Ottawa, March 20 (Reuters) - Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's government faced a new blow on Wednesday as a legislator quit his ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent in parliament, marking the latest fallout from a political scandal that has dogged the prime minister since February 7. Trudeau has been on the defensive since it was alleged that his staff pressured former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure that construction company SNC-Lavalin Group Inc. avoided a bribery trial. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of winning an election scheduled for October this year.

On Friday, the Supreme Court asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to review a proposal by the Agra Municipal Corporation to set up a waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site. Agra falls under the Taj Trapezium Zone, a 10,400 sq km area that spans across the districts of Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras and Etah in Uttar Pradesh and Bharatpur in Rajasthan. The Agra Municipal Corporation, an urban local body, had approached the Supreme Court seeking permission to set up a waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site. The Supreme Court has asked NEERI and CPCB to review the proposal. The Taj Trapezium Zone is a specially designated environmental protection area aimed at protecting historical buildings like the Taj Mahal from pollution.

If the Old Fish House could talk, imagine the fascinating stories she would share about the 100 years she has spent alongside the Indian River Lagoon. Washington D.C., July 31, 2018/3:01 p.m. - The U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit ruled on Tuesday that the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority has the right to ban religious-themed ads from the Archdiocese of Washington. In November 2015, the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority issued 14 new advertising guidelines for ads on its buses and trains. Guideline 12 explicitly prohibited "advertisements that promote or oppose any religion, religious practice or belief." The new guidelines were issued after someone attempted to purchase an ad featuring an image of Muhammad.

The Dillard High School Jazz Ensemble of Fort Lauderdale will be hosting a concert at the African American Research Library and Cultural Center in Fort Lauderdale on October 22. The concert, themed "Discovering Jazz," will take the audience through the evolution of jazz from the early 20th century to the present. Led by conductor Christopher Dorsey, the jazz ensemble won first place at this year's Ellington High School Jazz Competition and Festival in New York City, one of the most prestigious high school jazz competitions in the nation. Maureen Wilkes thinks it's time to understand the true impact of the Vietnam War on veterans' children. Like many other children of veterans, I am a statistic. If this study had been done years ago, maybe it should have been, maybe I would have realized what was happening to me, not to mention my father. Hello, I am the wife of a Vietnam vet, and I have three children. My first daughter was from my first marriage when I was 18, and my next two daughters were from my second marriage in 1970.

Albany - Governor Andrew Cuomo, who has two Twitter accounts with more than 863,000 followers, referred to the popular social media site as an "elite bulletin board" on Tuesday and said he doesn't look at it. "We created an echo chamber for the elites to talk to themselves, this unrealistic world in this small bubble that prohibits political wisdom, thinking it represents the world," he said in an interview with WAMC radio. Cuomo has two Twitter accounts, one with 853,000 followers and another with 10,400 followers. He said during his re-election campaign last year, reporters told him to follow the trends on Twitter.

Behind me were two Greensboro pitchers, Trevor Richards and Ben Meyer, charting the game. Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif called on Prime Minister Imran Khan at the Prime Minister's Office on Friday, with both sides emphasizing the need to promote bilateral relations in all areas of cooperation. Prime Minister Imran Khan stated that Pakistan and Iran are key to regional growth and prosperity, which can be achieved by enhancing connectivity and promoting people-to-people exchanges, according to Radio Pakistan. The Prime Minister thanked the Iranian Supreme Leader for his support for the Kashmiri people's struggle for self-determination. Zarif conveyed a message from Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, inviting the Prime Minister to attend the Asian Cooperation Dialogue summit to be held in Iran in October this year.

Without a doubt, the addiction drama "Beautiful Boy" - not the horror film "Halloween" - is the most frightening film in theaters this weekend. Starring Steve Carell and Timothée Chalamet, the movie provides a haunting and unsettling portrayal of a young man's descent into methamphetamine addiction (as well as heroin, pills, and marijuana) and the efforts of a devoted father to save him. It's a true and terrifying story, so powerful that even uninspired direction and clichéd writing can't diminish its impact.

Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray urged Union Agriculture Minister and NCP leader Sharad Pawar to resign from the Central Cabinet and return to Maharashtra to protect the interests of drought-affected farmers. After visiting the family of farmer Gajanan Ghotekar, who had recently committed suicide, Thackeray told the media yesterday that he had appealed to farmers not to vote for the NCP and the Congress. Uddhav met the family of the deceased farmer and, although he did not provide any immediate financial assistance, he promised to take care of the education of the children. Thackeray said that Ghotekar had blamed the Congress and the NCP for the plight of farmers in his suicide note.

Recent studies have shown that dementia patients can gain great benefits from participating in art therapy. While many people believe that eating well and exercising are key to healthy aging, the International Journal of Geriatric Psychiatry found that certain personality traits can also have a huge impact on your life in old age. We all have busy lives, but it's even more important to stay connected with loved ones if you've recently moved into an assisted living house or memory care cottage. Nutrition is important for everyone, but it's especially crucial for the elderly.

United Nations, 6 July, Update -- With the mandate of the United Nations Mission in Sudan set to expire on 8 July, and South Sudan due to declare independence the following day, a Security Council resolution on the creation of a new mission in South Sudan had yet to be adopted as of 6 July in New York. The incline bench press is a strength training exercise that targets the upper chest and the front shoulders. Alternatively, an incline chest press machine can be used to replicate the movement, with the machine moving on a fixed plane. The incline bench press is one of several exercises that can help create a symmetrical and strong upper body.

The unemployment rate in Stark County fell to 6.8% in August, the lowest since September 2008. Stark County's unemployment rate dropped below 7% for the first time since 2008, and the decline can be attributed to several factors. The most likely reason is the oil and gas extraction from the Utica Shale, which has led to an influx of businesses into the area. Oil exploration companies were the first to arrive, followed by engineering and construction companies that provide various services. Manufacturing also experienced growth due to increased demand for steel and drilling equipment from both local and national sources.

Los Angeles (AP) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will undergo surgery on Wednesday to repair the ligaments torn when he severely sprained his right ankle. Data released by the Korean Ocean and Shipbuilding Association confirmed the expectations of many analysts: the number of active shipyards around the world has decreased by more than 40% compared to seven years ago. The study defined an active yard as a facility with at least one vessel in its order book. The number of active Chinese yards decreased from 380 to 140, and Japanese yards decreased from 70 to 60 during the same period, according to the association. What's worse, the world's largest shipyards - Daewoo Shipbuilding, Hyundai Heavy Industries, and Samsung Heavy Industries - may have idle space and unused capacity sometime next year.

New research shows that mice with induced Alzheimer's-like symptoms had improved cognitive function after receiving synthetic estrogen-like hormones. However, unlike estrogen, which can cause the uterus to grow and is a known risk factor for uterine and breast cancers, PPT did not noticeably alter the reproductive tract of the animals. "This could be a promising strategy for maximizing the benefits of hormone therapy while minimizing its risks," Pike said.

Will it last for years to come? According to analysis by internet experts, the massive email worm MyDoom, which began spreading yesterday, is the fastest-spreading software virus to date, and its impact may last for years to come. Also known as Novarg and Mimail.R, the MyDoom worm began spreading on the internet yesterday. According to CNet News, it currently accounts for 1 in every 12 emails being transmitted on the global network. The virus spreads as an email attachment, infecting computer users who open the malicious file. Once opened, the virus installs a hidden program, opening a "back door" that hackers can use to take control of infected computers.

Several bills in the New Jersey State House have garnered the attention of truckers and other road users in the state. Repeat drunk driving offenders may soon face stricter penalties. Current New Jersey law only limits punishment for affected offenders to a traffic offense. Bail is typically set at $2,500. Omaha, Nebraska - Nebraska University men's basketball player Deverell Biggs has been ticketed for allegedly driving under the influence and leaving the scene of an accident. According to a police report, Biggs backed his Chevrolet Suburban into a vehicle owned by a Bellevue man at 1:35 a.m. Sunday, and after a brief conversation with the other driver, he drove away. Police stopped Biggs a few miles away, and his blood-alcohol content was 0.134, exceeding the legal limit of 0.08. The 20-year-old Biggs was also cited for minor in possession of alcohol and unsafe backing.

Harrisburg, Pennsylvania -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General's office announced it will be releasing over $55 million in funding to thousands of volunteer fire departments. Officials say the funding will be allocated based on population and the number of volunteer fire departments. All 66 counties in the state, except for Philadelphia, will receive funding, including at least $57,000 to each county in northeastern and central Pennsylvania. Luzerne County will receive the largest amount: $1.1 million. The volunteer firefighters at the Harveys Lake Fire Department, located in the Back Mountain area of Luzerne County, are dispatched around the clock to various locations throughout the county.

Brazil is currently implementing the "Brasil Sem Miséria" (Brazil Without Misery) program, a project that continues the successful "Fome Zero" (Zero Hunger) program, according to Marques Porto. In 2003, former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva launched the "Fome Zero" program, which is believed to have lifted 30 to 40 million Brazilians out of poverty. One of the core actions of the program was to provide free school lunches to poor children, which were purchased by the government from family farms. This approach not only supported local small farmers but also provided quality nutrition to children from low-income families.

The Russian data center market is experiencing continuous growth, as evidenced by the significant increase in the number of operational facilities. Consumers are no longer surprised by data centers that occupy several thousand square meters and contain 1,000 or more racks - these have become commonplace. According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, over the past two years, the Russian data center market has led in terms of total investment, surpassing India, China, and Brazil. Similarly, based on the latest construction data for the same period, Russia ranks second among BRICS countries in terms of total area, behind only Brazil.

Geneva – The head of the United Nations fact-finding mission on the Gaza conflict, Judge Richard Goldstone, today urged the international community to take action to end impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territory as he presented the mission's report to the Human Rights Council. Following a three-month investigation, the four-member mission concluded that Israel's military operation in Gaza from December 27, 2008, to January 18, 2009, severely violated international human rights and humanitarian law, and that Israel's actions constituted war crimes and possibly crimes against humanity. The mission's report also found that Hamas had attacked civilians, violating international humanitarian law. Judge Goldstone emphasized that the international community must take action to hold Israel and Hamas accountable and ensure justice for victims.

Oden Technologies is a startup tech company that aims to make factories smarter through its big data and Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) platform.
